JobTitle: Connectivity Technologies and Ecosystems Manager (IP/MPLS & Optical)
JobFullDesc: Attempting to connect the world requires an alternative approach to building and deploying telecom network infrastructure. Through organizations like the Telecom Infra Project (www.telecominfraproject.com (http://www.telecominfraproject.com/)) and through direct engagement with individual operators around the world, the team collaborates globally with the telecom industry to identify and execute a range of connectivity programs. If you have passion for working with operators, ISPs and other industry stakeholders to drive innovative, cutting edge, cost efficient wireless and network infrastructure projects that will deliver internet access to the unconnected while significantly scaling current networks – then this is a great role for you.As a CTEM, you will work closely with the Facebook Connectivity and the Telecom Infra Project (TIP) foundation to help move different IP and Optical transport programs forward. Through the role, you will interface with telecom operators, with engineers developing telecom infrastructure technologies, with key hardware, software and system integration partners to design, build and deploy open and disaggregated technologies.Strategize cross-functionally with multiple industry stakeholders to identify technology solutions, identify technological and business gaps, drive additional ecosystem partner participation within TIP, partnering with internal organizations and the external partner community to build cutting edge products.Carefully track industry trends to develop new transport products that represent a technical and/or commercial advantage for network operators.Be the technical expert who questions the status quo and uses their strategic  vision for the connectivity technology landscape to shape TIP efforts  across access, backhaul and core domains.Manage TIP projects and support their entrance and exit process including lab and field trials, product validation and deployment.Advocate,  internally at Facebook, through the Telecom Infra Project (TIP),  and the partner community at large on how to maximize opportunities to  successfully deploy new telecom hardware and software contributions across  the industry.Guide  retrospective reviews of completed projects with teams to incorporate  lessons learned into team’s future roadmaps & goals.Identify  key metrics/measures that will be used to evaluate success and validate  the business impact of the program.Ability  to understand high level architecture for system dependencies and  translate these into technical roadmapsAlign  cross-functional stakeholders on objectives and goals for the program,  gather and prioritize requirements.Manage expectations of all interested parties – define clear program with key deliverables and milestone dates.
